macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Indices End Week Higher Despite Tech Sell-Off
items.summary: The Dow Jones rose 1.68% to 50,115.67, S&P 500 gained 1.42% to 6,932.30, and Nasdaq 100 increased 1.68% to 25,075.77, buoyed by AI spending signals amid a bloody week for tech and crypto.

items.title: Indian Markets Surge 1.5% on RBI Rate Hold and US-India Trade Deal
items.summary: Indian equities closed 1.5% higher for the second week, with RBI maintaining repo rates at 5.25% and a new US-India trade deal cutting export tariffs from 50% to 18%; Power Grid and Adani Enterprises led gains.

items.title: Amazon Earnings Miss but AI Capex Boosts Nvidia, AMD, Broadcom
items.summary: Amazon reported a Q4 earnings miss despite beating revenue estimates and guided 2026 capex up to $200B for AWS AI growth, lifting AI stocks like Nvidia, AMD, and Broadcom while its shares fell.

items.title: AI Adoption Fuels Gains Across Marketing, Manufacturing, Pharma Sectors
items.summary: AI adoption is driving stock gains in diverse industries like marketing, manufacturing, and pharmaceuticals, with early winners emerging per Sparkline Capital analysis.

items.title: Bitcoin Slides Below $70K to 15-Month Low, Dragging Crypto Stocks
items.summary: Bitcoin fell below $70,000, down 44% from its October peak, hitting a 15-month low and pressuring crypto-related stocks like MicroStrategy amid market volatility.

items.title: FDA Warning on Copycat Drugs Lifts Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly Shares
items.summary: Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly stocks rose after FDA warning on illegal copycat weight loss drugs, supporting leading names in the sector.

items.title: Airline Stocks Climb on Falling Oil Prices and US-Iran Talks
items.summary: Alaska Air, Delta, and United Airlines shares advanced as oil prices dropped amid US-Iran talks raising supply relief hopes.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Price Rebounds Above $71,000 Amid Institutional Buying
items.summary: Bitcoin has reclaimed $71,000 following a sharp sell-off to near $60,000 earlier this week, with institutional investors buying the dip while retail traders remain cautious. The price is stabilizing around $71,000-$71,467, up 3.12% in the past day, with potential to test $72,000-$75,000 if resistance breaks.[1][3]

items.title: Bitcoin Mining Stocks to Watch: IREN, Marathon Digital, and Others
items.summary: MarketBeat highlights IREN, Marathon Digital, TeraWulf, Cipher Mining, and Cleanspark as top Bitcoin-related stocks due to high trading volume amid recent market volatility. These firms operate bitcoin mining data centers, with IREN focusing on low-carbon power.[2]

items.title: Crypto Prediction Markets Favor Bitcoin at $75,000 for February
items.summary: Prediction markets show $75,000 as the leading February price target for Bitcoin at 64% probability with $37M volume, while spot trading holds near $68,314-$70,483 after rebound. Major cryptocurrencies show mixed performance.[4][5]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Seven AI Stocks Worth Watching Today
items.summary: MarketBeat identified Tempus AI, Hut 8, SoundHound AI, BigBear.ai, Fluence Energy, OneStream, and Upstart as top artificial intelligence stocks to watch, based on highest dollar trading volume among AI companies.

items.title: Quantum AI Systems Emerging as Major Technology Trend
items.summary: Analysis of 700 recent news articles reveals significant focus on the convergence of AI and quantum computing, with clustering results highlighting 'Quantum' as a prominent topic promising groundbreaking advancements in AI technology.

items.title: IFR Reports AI as Core Enabler of Robotics Adoption
items.summary: The International Federation of Robotics released a position paper showing AI is becoming essential for robotics, with machine vision, autonomous mobility, and six core AI subfields driving commercial value in manufacturing, logistics, and service environments.

items.title: AI-Powered Cybersecurity Threats Accelerating in 2026
items.summary: Threat actors are increasingly using AI to automate attack chains and operate at machine speed, compressing intrusion-to-impact timelines from days to minutes, while defenders struggle with human-paced security models.

items.title: AI Joins Climate and Nuclear Threats in Scientists' Urgent Warnings
items.summary: Artificial intelligence has been added to the Doomsday Clock at 85 seconds to midnight, joining climate change and nuclear weapons as humanity's most pressing existential threats according to leading scientists.

items.title: Apple Releases Xcode 26.3 with Advanced AI Integration
items.summary: Apple's latest Xcode update integrates agentic AI support, allowing developers to leverage Anthropic's Claude Agent and OpenAI's Codex directly within the development platform to reduce coding errors and accelerate prototyping.

items.title: CoreWeave Launches ARENA Lab for AI Production Testing
items.summary: CoreWeave unveiled its ARENA platform designed to test AI workloads in real-world production settings, replacing traditional sandbox environments with scalable compute resources that simulate high-demand scenarios.

items.title: Startup Mercor Trains Unemployed Workers to Build AI Systems
items.summary: Mercor is paying long-term unemployed workers to train AI models designed to automate the very tasks they previously performed in their former jobs, highlighting emerging labor market disruptions.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Minneapolis Gaming Livestream Raises $250K for Rent Aid Amid ICE Surge
items.summary: Content creators in Minneapolis hosted a video game livestream that successfully raised $250,000 to aid rent assistance during an ICE surge. The event highlights the gaming community's charitable efforts.

items.title: Dragon Quest VII Reimagined Platforms Confirmed for Multi-Platform Release
items.summary: Square Enix's reimagined Dragon Quest VII, originally from 2000, will launch on Nintendo Switch, Switch 2, Xbox Series X|S, PS5, and PC. The announcement details extensive marketing ahead of release.

items.title: Asojuegos Launches First Sustainability Report for Colombia's Gaming Industry
items.summary: Colombia's Asojuegos, representing 35 gaming companies, begins its inaugural sustainability report using Global Reporting Initiative standards to promote transparency and responsibility. The move marks industry maturity with benefits for ESG data management.

items.title: Chief Delphi Forum Discusses Potential Leaks of FIRST Robotics Seasons
items.summary: A post on Chief Delphi raises concerns about whether FIRST Robotics Competition seasons are leaked to teams before official announcements. The discussion, dated February 8, 2026, sparks community debate on esports and competitive integrity.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Malaysia and India Strengthen Semiconductor Cooperation
items.summary: Prime Ministers Modi and Anwar welcomed growing bilateral investments in semiconductors, advanced manufacturing, and digital economy during a joint statement on February 7, 2026. They commended initiatives like IIT-Madras Global with Malaysia's Advanced Semiconductor Academy and IESA with MSIA to enhance the semiconductor value chain.

items.title: Malaysia-India Digital Council Formalized for Fintech and Cybersecurity Collaboration
items.summary: Leaders applauded the establishment of the Malaysia–India Digital Council to advance digital cooperation in fintech, e-governance, cybersecurity, and emerging technologies. They also welcomed NPCI International and PayNet Malaysia's payment linkages for seamless remittances and business transactions.

items.title: ICE Deploys Neighborhood Phone Tracking Tools Amid Surveillance Concerns
items.summary: ICE has purchased advanced area monitoring systems capable of tracking phones across neighborhoods, linking video, facial recognition, and location data in a maturing surveillance ecosystem. Civil liberties groups raise concerns over tools that could follow individuals from protests to homes or workplaces.
